fields.headline: Note to self
fields.bodyText: Avoid this Christmas. It's only been cold for about five seconds - but already the low-level whine of retailers pedalling festive tat is reaching uncomfortable levels. Work isn't safe either, what with the cards, rotas and parties to bicker about. Rise above it all by refusing to even utter the X-word until December 1. Bah Humbug! Buy this Coffee runs leaving you skint? Get a piggy helper for gathering up all those pesky coppers, and riches (or cappuccinos) can be yours. Better still, at a mere fiver from John Lewis, this beast isn't going to cost you more than you save. And, as he can only be opened via smashing, he'll keep your cash safe. Play this There's nothing like fog and a slight chill to scare a commuter off the pavement and on to the bus. But don't let your fitness regime go to pot - unleash your inner footy/hockey/netball star and get on the games field. And what better motivation than a team of colleagues swearing at your every off-target pass? Drink this Or, in fact, don't drink this. Red wine is a fine friend. But as December and its non-stop booze schedule looms, take stock with a small, but timely, detox before every drop of liquid in your body is replaced by revolting mulled wine and festive cheer. Read this A book deal for writing about how to have great ideas? Isn't that the best idea going? But Chris Baréz Brown's tome (How to Have Kick-Ass Ideas, £12.99) is a jolly change from dry business advice. And, if it prompts one genius idea, you can upgrade that piggy for something larger. An elephant, perhaps?
